result.execSummary:
The defendant Erick F Reyes-Luna was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Sauk County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: Provide DNA sample.  Undergo any counseling/treatment per agent to include Criminal Thinking.  Absolute Sobriety.  No weapons.   ALL COURT ORDERED OBLIGATIONS TO BE PAID THROUGH CLERK OF COURTS

If probation/extended supervision revoked or discharges with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Erick F Reyes-Luna in court with attorney Andrew I. Martinez.  Defendant Erick F Reyes-Luna in custody.  Dennis Joseph Ryan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  No Contest Plea entered, advised of constitutional rights, plea accepted by Court.  Court finds Defendant guilty.  Court withholds sentence.  DE advised of firearm warnings, appeal rights and voting rights.

Count 1: as amended per information filed today - NC

3 years Probation
186 days credit if revoked
Criminal thinking
Absolute sobriety at all times
No weapons
DNA sample to be provided
Undergo any counseling per agent
$518.00 Fine/Costs fees paid within 60 days or set up a payment plan. (PAID THRU CLERK OF COURTS) 
Must report to P&P by noon on August 1, 2016
Paperwork handed in court.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Defendant Erick F Reyes-Luna appeared by video means from LEC w/atty. Deb ORourke. Prosecuting Atty Sue Mueller appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives reading of complaint.  Advised rights to an attorney. DE does qualify for PD representation. State requests $10,000.00 Cash bond. Atty. ORourke requests PA bond, no warrant, violent history.  Requests Preliminary hearing; Time limits NOT waived.  $10,000.00 CASH bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows: Not leave State of WI; Not permitted to go armed; Not go upon premises of Olympia hotel; No contact w/I.O. and G.W.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 3, 2016 at 10:45 am.
